image_1.context: The scale of the wreckage was staggering, FORT MYERS, Fla.- The extent of Hurricane Ian's destruction became clearer on Thursday as people across southwestern Florida, left without electricity, drinking water or inhabitabie homes, began to assess the damage and gird for what Gov. Ron DeSantis said would be a yearslong recovery. This article is by Patricia Mazzei, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Frances Robles and Jack Healy. Death Toll From Hurricane lan May Jump Hurricane Ian's aftermath included flooding in Port Charlotte, Fla., top, and wreckage in Fort Myers Beach, above. Marvis Long, middle, said “everything floated" in her North Fort Myers home.  western suburb of Kyiv, Russian soldiers disobeyed orders by making unauthorized calls from their cellphones to their wives, girlfriends, friends and parents hundreds of miles from the front line. Someone else was listening in: the Ukrainian government.   The New York Times has exclusively obtained recordings of thousands of calls that were made throughout March and intercepted by Ukrainian law enforcement agencies from this pivotal location. Reporters verified the authenticity of these calls by cross-referencing the Russian phone numbers with messaging apps and social media profiles to identify soldiers and family members. image_1.description: The image depicts a flooded residential area, likely in Florida, following the aftermath of Hurricane Ian. The scene shows a neighborhood with numerous houses, many of which are submerged in water. The water has inundated the streets and yards, reaching up to the walls of some homes. Palm trees and other vegetation are partially submerged, indicating the depth of the floodwaters. A vehicle is seen driving through the flooded street, creating a wake behind it. The sky is partly cloudy, suggesting recent or ongoing weather disturbances. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of devastation and the scale of the hurricane's impact on the community.

image_2.description:
The image is divided into two distinct sections. The top section shows an elderly couple standing in a living room that has been damaged by floodwaters. The woman, wearing a floral blouse and black pants, stands next to the man, who is dressed in a green hoodie and red shorts. They appear to be assessing the damage. The room contains various furniture items, including a wooden dresser with a lamp on top, a couch covered with a blanket, and a chair. The floor is wet and muddy, indicating recent flooding. The background shows a window with blinds partially open, allowing natural light to enter.

  The bottom section of the image depicts a marina that has been severely damaged by Hurricane Ian. Several boats are capsized and scattered around, with debris and wreckage strewn across the area. The water level is high, suggesting recent flooding. The scene conveys a sense of devastation and destruction caused by the hurricane.

  The overall mood of the image is one of desolation and recovery, highlighting the extensive damage caused by Hurricane Ian in southwestern Florida.
